Notes on Performance & Intelligence Work Chapter 1 Prerequisites

Notes on Performance & Intelligence Work Laurie Platt 2021-02-20 Chapter 1 Prerequisites This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandoc’s Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.name/tinytex/.
Chapter 2 R Markdown 2.1 R Markdown vs Markdown 2.2 Bookdown

Chapter 2 R Markdown 2.1 R Markdown vs Markdown 2.2 Bookdown These notes are written using the bookdown package (Xie 2020), which was built on to The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. 2.2.1 Publishing These notes are published on GitHub Pages with GitHub Actions. The GitHub Action is triggered by a push to the master branch. The action first renders the repository’s R Markdown files to HTML and deploys the HTML files as a static website to a branch called gh-pages. Alternatives to using GitHub Actions include Travis or Jekyll. I used the steps outlined in the following blog post: https://medium.com/@delucmat/how-to-publish-bookdown-projects-with-github-actions-on-github-pages-6e6aecc7331e However, I did a lot of the git bash commands manually and there were two fixes I had to make to deploy_bookdown.yaml: with: build_dir: _book/ email: ${{ secrets.EMAIL }} under uses: Cecilapp/GitHub-Pages-deploy@master and GITHUB_TOKEN rather than GH_PAT as this is what GitHub-Pages-deploy now uses https://github.com/Cecilapp/GitHub-Pages-deploy References
